result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawnee M Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution joint and several with Jamee Jacobe. To pay any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Detp. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Sentence can be served in Kewaunee County. Defendant is responsible for notifying the Door County Jail if sentence is being served in a different county. Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

records.descr: Notice to D.A./D.A. response on pet. for sent. adj

records.addlTxt: from defendant with her request for sentence modification.

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by DOC Records office staff and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.       (Order faxed to RECC at 9:55 AM.  Hard copy also mailed 8/28/19)
from Paula Stoudt of Robert E. Ellsworth Correctional Center advising defendant has completed the ERP program.

Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

from defendant requesting furlough. Judge Diltz responds in Judge Ehlers absence. On a straight jail sentence, no authority to extend report dates past 60 days. Denied. PCD

Restitution summary
Email between DA Pelrine and DOC Agent Kim Bridenhagen with clarification of sentence DOC is recommending.

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State gives recommendation, makes sentencing statement.  Atty Gerbers gives sentencing argument. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Amended
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Cts. 2 & 3 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay the DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has not prepared Defendant for a plea today, wants to find out what new case will do to offer on file. State advises of multiple cases in multiple counties, advises that new offer won't affect old offer. Defense needs time to speak with Defendant.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing at 06-11-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of attempts to pursue alternative Court in Brown County, request cases be set off 60 days. State has no objection, will not agree to consolidation to Brown County. Court clarifies that it will require coordination of dispositions in both counties.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that cases are not resolved, requests status date.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Shawnee M Reed in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 09:15 am.
